snippet: China has razed thousands of traditional homes as it modernizes Kashgar, and the results underscore the divide between the government and the Muslim ethnic minority, the Uighurs.
abstract: Kashgar Journal; China has razed thousands of traditional homes as it modernizes ancient Silk Road city Kashgar, and results underscore divide between the government and Uighurs, Muslim ethnic minority; Chinese authorities promised to preserve Kashgar’s fabled Old City district, but many Uighurs view demolition as physical symbol of Chinese government’s efforts to destroy their cultural identity.
lead_paragraph: China has razed thousands of traditional homes as it modernizes Kashgar, and the results underscore the divide between the government and the Muslim ethnic minority, the Uighurs.

headline.main: China Remodels an Ancient Silk Road City, and an Ethnic Rift Widens
headline.print_headline: China Remodels an Ancient Silk Road City, and an Ethnic Rift Widens
